body: Hey, @pdxjohnny I'd like to work on this issue!

@sakshamarora1 Hmm, I've been thinking on this and I'm not sure there's a great way to come at this right now. I think that https://github.com/intel/dffml/issues/326 would be the best place to start. Then we need to do #325. As you'll find when doing #326, there's a lot going on with the config stuff. It's what let's us specify the plugin name, and the config for that plugin. In the case of sources. It's still using the CLI style config stuff. Which is different and can't [yet](https://github.com/intel/dffml/issues/325) leverage the same way we allow for configuration of the class itself (sources in this case)
@pdxjohnny I'll dive into it then, thanks!

rename.from: source: Establish common way to pass arguments to the Sources class
rename.to: source: Establish common way to pass arguments to subclasses of list/collections.UserList

issue.title: source: Add configuration parameter to Sources to toggle combination

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

issue.body: In https://github.com/intel/dffml/commit/dd5a7103149a52617ac05608a6c6d720f26d7b9a we added the `repo.merge`s and the `break` which make it so that all data sources combine their data. Users may want this functionality sometimes but not other times. This should be a config option of the `Sources` class.
